korean: 오늘 팀 회식이 있어서 저녁에 삼겹살집에 갔다.
이번 달 실적이 좋아서 팀장님이 쏘신다고 하셨어.
평소에 업무 얘기만 하다가 사적인 얘기를 들으니까 동료들이 새롭게 느껴졌다.
한 선배는 취미가 등산이래서 주말마다 산 간다고 하더라.
막내 동료는 결혼 준비 중이라고 했어. 축하해줬다.
고기 구워 먹으면서 웃고 떠들다 보니까 스트레스가 풀리더라.
2차로 노래방까지 갔는데 다들 신나게 노래 불렀다.
팀장님이 트로트 부르시는데 진짜 잘하셔서 놀랐어.
나도 몇 곡 불렀는데 다들 박수쳐줘서 기분 좋았다.
집에 와서 샤워하고 누웠는데 피곤하지만 기분은 좋다.
이런 시간이 있어야 팀워크가 좋아지는 것 같아.
내일 아침이 걱정되긴 하지만 오늘은 즐겁게 보냈다.
english: We had a team dinner tonight and went to a pork belly place.
We hit our targets this month, so our team leader said it was on them.
Hearing my coworkers talk about personal stuff instead of just work made me see them in a new light.
One senior colleague said their hobby is hiking and they go every weekend.
The youngest team member is getting married soon. I congratulated them.
Grilling meat and laughing together helped me destress, you know.
We even went to karaoke for round two, and everyone had a blast singing.
Our team leader sang trot songs and honestly, they were really good. I was surprised.
I sang a few songs too and everyone clapped, which felt nice.
I came home, showered, and crashed—I'm tired, but in a good mood.
I think having times like this is what makes teamwork better.
I'm kinda worried about tomorrow morning, but I had a fun time today.
